headline: Heard on the Street Tuesday Recap: Powered Down
summary: JPMorgan gave a bum start to bank earnings. The Dow industrials component slid 4.2% after results showed a surprise slip in investment-banking fees and a significant charge for taking over the Apple credit-card program.

headline: Meta is a 'hated' name right now, but this analyst is still bullish
summary: Meta's (META) artificial intelligence (AI) efforts are in focus after the company hired President Trump's former security adviser, Dina Powell McCormick, as its new president and vice chair. Meta also announced a new AI compute initiative. Jefferies senior analyst Brent Thill joins Market Domination Overtime with Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Brooke DiPalma to dive deeper into Meta's AI plans. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime.

headline: Belgian cybersecurity startup Aikido hits unicorn status with new funding round
summary: STOCKHOLM, Jan 14 - Belgium's Aikido Security has raised $60 million from investors led ​by tech-focused private equity firm DST Global ‌at a valuation of $1 billion, the cybersecurity startup said on ‌Wednesday, making it among Europe's first new unicorns of 2026. Founded in 2022, Aikido's security software helps developers detect and address risk automatically. It counts mobile app ⁠and game developer ‌Niantic, fintech Revolut and music streaming platform SoundCloud among its customers.

content.title: Belgian cybersecurity startup Aikido hits unicorn status with new funding round
content.summary: STOCKHOLM, Jan 14 - Belgium's Aikido Security has raised $60 million from investors led ​by tech-focused private equity firm DST Global ‌at a valuation of $1 billion, the cybersecurity startup said on ‌Wednesday, making it among Europe's first new unicorns of 2026. Founded in 2022, Aikido's security software helps developers detect and address risk automatically. It counts mobile app ⁠and game developer ‌Niantic, fintech Revolut and music streaming platform SoundCloud among its customers.

headline: 2026’s Biggest AI Trends: The Rise of AI Factories | VRT Stock, NVT Stock, MOD Stock
summary: 24/7 Wall St. Analysts Eric Bleeker and Austin Smith are kicking the New Year off in style with 12 trends for AI investors to watch in 2026. Over the course of 12 videos, the two will share their thoughts on everything from the memory explosion to software stocks to robotics. In this video, Eric takes a deeper look at the rise of AI factories, massive data centers with a capacity of more than 1 gigawatt. As Eric notes, it's not just Oracle's Stargate getting into the race. There are also new super factories from Microsoft, Amazon, Meta, and many others. Companies with data center cooling portfolios like Vertiv (NYSE: VRT), nVent Electric (NYSE: NVT), Modine Manufacturing (NYSE: MOD) could be winners as the construction of this new generation of data centers takes off.

content.title: 2026’s Biggest AI Trends: The Rise of AI Factories | VRT Stock, NVT Stock, MOD Stock
content.description:
24/7 Wall St. Analysts Eric Bleeker and Austin Smith are kicking the New Year off in style with 12 trends for AI investors to watch in 2026. Over the course of 12 videos, the two will share their thoughts on everything from the memory explosion to software stocks to robotics.

In this video, Eric takes a deeper look at the rise of AI factories, massive data centers with a capacity of more than 1 gigawatt. As Eric notes, it's not just Oracle's Stargate getting into the race. There are also new super factories from Microsoft, Amazon, Meta, and many others. 

Companies with data center cooling portfolios like Vertiv (NYSE: VRT), nVent Electric (NYSE: NVT), Modine Manufacturing (NYSE: MOD) could be winners as the construction of this new generation of data centers takes off.

In this video, Eric takes a deeper look at the rise of AI factories, massive data centers with a capacity of more than 1 gigawatt. As Eric notes, it's not just Oracle's Stargate getting into the race. There are also new super factories from Microsoft, Amazon, Meta, and many others. Companies with data center cooling portfolios like Vertiv (NYSE: VRT), nVent Electric (NYSE: NVT), Modine Manufacturing (NYSE: MOD) could be winners as the construction of this new generation of data centers takes off.

headline: Meta Lays Off 1,500 People in Metaverse Division
summary: Meta Platforms  has laid off roughly 10% of staff, about 1,500 people, from its Reality Labs division, the unit that houses its virtual and augmented reality efforts, according to a person familiar with the matter.  In December, The Wall Street Journal reported that Meta was planning to make budget cuts to the teams working on what it calls the metaverse, an area that Meta Chief Executive  Mark Zuckerberg  once called the future of the company, and shift some spending over to development of AI glasses.  “We said last month that we were shifting some of our investment from Metaverse toward Wearables,” a Meta spokesman said.

content.title: Meta Lays Off 1,500 People in Metaverse Division
content.summary: Meta Platforms  has laid off roughly 10% of staff, about 1,500 people, from its Reality Labs division, the unit that houses its virtual and augmented reality efforts, according to a person familiar with the matter.  In December, The Wall Street Journal reported that Meta was planning to make budget cuts to the teams working on what it calls the metaverse, an area that Meta Chief Executive  Mark Zuckerberg  once called the future of the company, and shift some spending over to development of AI glasses.  “We said last month that we were shifting some of our investment from Metaverse toward Wearables,” a Meta spokesman said.

headline: Wikipedia unveils new AI licensing deals as it marks 25th birthday
summary: Wikipedia unveiled new business deals with a slew of artificial intelligence companies on Thursday as it marked its 25th anniversary.  The online crowdsourced encyclopedia revealed that it has signed licensing deals with AI companies including Amazon, Meta Platforms, Perplexity, Microsoft and France's Mistral AI.  Wikipedia is one of the last bastions of the early internet, but that original vision of a free online space has been clouded by the dominance of Big Tech platforms and the rise of generative AI chatbots trained on content scraped from the web.
